Description: Terracotta figure of Bes. A small figure of Bes, standing on a low flatfaced plinth; he is naked, his hands on his thighs, and wears a feathered headdress. Summary treatment at the back, and also a distinct step below the crown as though the object was a support for something (a tripod foot, or perhaps one of four feet). Hollow; two-piece mould. Micaceous brown Nile silt.
Curator's comments: BM Terracotta IV For the foot, see Terracotta 3667. Comparanda. Near: Bayer-Niemeier 1988: no. 439; Hilton Price 1897: 394, no. 3273, from Bubastis; Van Wijngaarden 1958: no. 38; Weber 1914: no. 250.
